briefdescription.para: Get start/stop register address for a sonicator.

simplesect.para: Register address for start/stop control

briefdescription.para: Get amplitude setpoint register address for a sonicator.

simplesect.para: Register address for amplitude setpoint

briefdescription.para: Get overload reset register address for a sonicator.

simplesect.para: Register address for overload reset command

briefdescription.para: Get raw ADC power register address for a sonicator.

simplesect.para: Register address for raw ADC power reading (0-1023)

briefdescription.para: Get frequency รท10 register address for a sonicator.

simplesect.para: Register address for frequency รท10 reading (more efficient)

simplesect.para: Register address for status flags

briefdescription.para: Get actual amplitude register address for a sonicator.

simplesect.para: Register address for actual amplitude reading

briefdescription.para: Overall system status register (0x0000)

detaileddescription.para: Bitfield containing system-wide status indicators

Bit definitions:
Bit 0 (0x0001): SYSTEM_STATUS_OK - System operating normally
Bit 1 (0x0002): SYSTEM_STATUS_FAULT - System fault detected
Bit 2 (0x0004): SYSTEM_STATUS_EMERGENCY_STOP - Emergency stop active
Bit 3 (0x0008): SYSTEM_STATUS_COMM_FAULT - Communication fault
Bit 4 (0x0010): SYSTEM_STATUS_OVERTEMP - Over temperature detected
Bits 5-15: Reserved for future system status flags

simplesect.para: Read-only register updated by system monitor every 10ms
REG_EMERGENCY_STOP for emergency stop control

briefdescription.para: Number of currently active sonicators (0x0001)

detaileddescription.para: Count of sonicators currently in running state (0-4)

simplesect.para: Updated in real-time as sonicators start/stop
REG_ACTIVE_MASK for individual sonicator status

briefdescription.para: Bitmask of currently running sonicators (0x0002)

detaileddescription.para: Bitfield indicating which sonicators are currently active

Bit definitions:
Bit 0 (0x0001): Sonicator 1 running status
Bit 1 (0x0002): Sonicator 2 running status
Bit 2 (0x0004): Sonicator 3 running status
Bit 3 (0x0008): Sonicator 4 running status
Bits 4-15: Reserved for future sonicator expansion

simplesect.para: Updated in real-time, synchronized with individual status flags

briefdescription.para: Watchdog timer status register (0x0003)

detaileddescription.para: System watchdog timer status and configuration

simplesect.para: Used for system health monitoring and fault detection
Watchdog timeout triggers system reset

briefdescription.para: Communication error counter (0x0004)

detaileddescription.para: Cumulative count of MODBUS communication errors

Includes:
CRC errors
Timeout errors
Frame errors
Invalid register access attempts

simplesect.para: Counter resets on system restart
High error count may indicate communication issues

briefdescription.para: Previous active sonicator mask (0x0005)

detaileddescription.para: Snapshot of active sonicators before last emergency stop or system fault

Used for:
Diagnostic purposes
Automatic restart after fault clearance
System state recovery

simplesect.para: Captured during emergency stop or fault conditions
REG_LAST_SHUTDOWN_REASON for shutdown cause

briefdescription.para: Last system shutdown reason code (0x0006)

detaileddescription.para: Enumerated reason for last system shutdown or fault

Reason codes:
0: Normal shutdown
1: Watchdog timeout
2: Over temperature
3: Emergency stop activated
4: Communication fault
5: Power supply fault
6-255: Reserved for future fault codes

simplesect.para: Persists across system restarts for diagnostic purposes

briefdescription.para: System uptime low 16 bits (0x0007)

detaileddescription.para: Lower 16 bits of system uptime in seconds
Combined with REG_SYSTEM_UPTIME_HI provides 32-bit uptime counter Maximum uptime: ~136 years before rollover

simplesect.para: Updated every second by system timer
REG_SYSTEM_UPTIME_HI for upper 16 bits

briefdescription.para: System uptime high 16 bits (0x0008)

detaileddescription.para: Upper 16 bits of system uptime in seconds

simplesect.para: Combined with REG_SYSTEM_UPTIME_LO for full 32-bit uptime
Useful for system reliability monitoring

briefdescription.para: Sonicator presence bitmask (0x0009)

detaileddescription.para: Bitmask indicating which sonicators are physically present

Bit definitions:
Bit 0 (0x0001): Sonicator 1 present
Bit 1 (0x0002): Sonicator 2 present
Bit 2 (0x0004): Sonicator 3 present
Bit 3 (0x0008): Sonicator 4 present
Bits 4-15: Reserved for future sonicator expansion

simplesect.para: Updated during system initialization
Useful for dynamic system configuration

briefdescription.para: Canonical MODBUS register addresses for complete Multi-Sonicator system.

detaileddescription.para: This enumeration provides named constants for all MODBUS register addresses in the Multi-Sonicator-IO system. Each register is documented with its address, access type, data format, and functional description.

sect1.title: Register Naming Convention
sect1.para:
Register names follow a structured pattern:
REG_: All register names start with this prefix
SONx_: Sonicator-specific registers include unit number (1-4)
Function: Descriptive name indicating register purpose
Type: Suffix indicating data type (RAW_ADC, DIV10_HZ, FLAGS, etc.)

sect1.title: Register Stride Architecture
sect1.para:
Each sonicator occupies exactly 32 registers (0x20 stride) organized as:
Control Block (0xN00-0xN0F): Read/write control registers
Status Block (0xN10-0xN1F): Read-only status and telemetry registers
This design allows for future expansion up to 32 sonicators while maintaining consistent addressing and efficient register access patterns.

listitem.para: uint16_t: All MODBUS registers are 16-bit unsigned integers
Raw ADC: 0-1023 range representing 10-bit ADC readings
Frequency: Hzรท10 values for efficient storage
Bitfields: Status flags packed into single registers

simplesect.para: Register addresses are calculated using SONICATOR_REG_ADDR() macro with zero-based IDs
All register access must be validated using IS_VALID_REGISTER_ADDR() function
Pin assignments are defined in config/hardware-config.yaml as the authoritative source

briefdescription.para: Check if a register address is valid for the system.

simplesect.para: true if address is valid, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Check if a register address is read-only.

simplesect.para: true if register is read-only, false if read/write

briefdescription.para: Get sonicator ID from a sonicator register address.

simplesect.para: Sonicator ID (0-3) or 0xFF if invalid

briefdescription.para: Get register offset within sonicator block from address.

simplesect.para: Register offset (0x00-0x1F) or 0xFF if invalid

briefdescription.para: @title MODBUS Register Address Map for Multi-Sonicator I/O Controller

detaileddescription.para:
Cannasol Technologies @company Axovia AI
2025-09-16
Comprehensive MODBUS RTU register address definitions and convenience macros for sonicator control and monitoring
1.1.0
This file provides the complete MODBUS register address map for the Multi-Sonicator-IO ATmega32A controller. It defines canonical register addresses for all sonicator control and monitoring functions, following industrial MODBUS RTU standards.

The register map is organized into three main sections:
System Status Registers (0x0000-0x000F): Read-only system-wide status and diagnostics
Global Control Registers (0x0010-0x001F): Read/write global system control commands
Per-Sonicator Registers (0x0100-0x041F): Individual sonicator control and status (32 registers per unit)

sect1.title: Register Architecture
sect1.para:
The system supports up to 32 sonicators with a 32-register stride (0x20) per unit:
Control Block (0xN00-0xN0F): Read/write control registers
Status Block (0xN10-0xN1F): Read-only status and telemetry registers

Currently implemented sonicators:
Sonicator 1 (ID=0): 0x0100-0x011F
Sonicator 2 (ID=1): 0x0120-0x013F
Sonicator 3 (ID=2): 0x0140-0x015F
Sonicator 4 (ID=3): 0x0160-0x017F

sect1.title: Raw Data Architecture
sect1.para:
This implementation prioritizes ATmega32A efficiency by storing raw sensor data:
Power registers: Raw 10-bit ADC values (0-1023) instead of converted watts
Frequency registers: Hzรท10 values directly from CT2000 hardware
Cloud conversion: All scaling and unit conversions performed in PLC/cloud layer

sect1.title: Hardware Pin Mapping
sect1.para: All pin assignments are defined in config/hardware-config.yaml as the SOLE SOURCE OF TRUTH. This register map provides the MODBUS interface to those hardware signals.

listitem.para: Update Rate: โฅ10Hz telemetry refresh per NFR9
Communication: MODBUS RTU at 115200 baud, 8N1, Slave ID=2
Latency: โค200ms end-to-end command latency per NFR1

simplesect.para: All register addresses must be validated using IS_VALID_REGISTER_ADDR() before access
Write operations to read-only registers will be ignored or return error codes
config/hardware-config.yaml Hardware pin assignments (authoritative source)
src/modules/communication/modbus_registers.h MODBUS register structure definitions
docs/cloud-conversion-guide.md Raw data conversion formulas for cloud processing
This file follows Axovia AI documentation standards and generates comprehensive API documentation via Doxygen for integration teams and cloud developers.
